It is a coniferous evergreen tree characterized by its slender, pyramidal shape and dark green, needle-like leaves. The cones are typically small and cylindrical, maturing to a reddish-brown color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
